intro: Ditassa obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate ditassa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its broad, ovate-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
